API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.materials.videoex.VideoMaterialEx

type
class
extends
sandy.materials.BitmapMaterial
implements
flash.events.IEventDispatcher
version
3.2
since
3.2
Displays an flv or rtmp stream as a 3D shape material. Network events are all handled, so that if an rtmp server drops, automatic reconnection will be tried. The events broadcast by this class are BubbleEvent types, but do not have a parent to bubble from, so they are dispatched directly from the video material.

Static Variables

COMPLETE(inline,null) : String

Dispatched when video is complete, with no loops remaining.

CONNECT(inline,null) : String

Dispatched when a successful connection is made, and the netStream object is valid.

CUEPOINT(inline,null) : String

Dispatched by the default clientNetStream object handler for NetStream when cue point events are received. The event will have it's info property set to the object provided by NetStream If the clientNetStream property is changed, you will not receive these events.

DEFAULT_ERRORS_SHOW_URL : Bool

Determines whether the video source url will be displayed on the texture in case of an error. Defaults to false, set to true for more informative textures

DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR : Int

Default color used to draw the bitmapdata content. In case you need a specific color, change this value at your application initialization.

LOOP(inline,null) : String

Dispatched when video starts a new loop

METADATA(inline,null) : String

Dispatched by the default clientNetStream object handler for NetStream when meta data events are received. The event will have it's info property set to the object provided by NetStream If the clientNetStream property is changed, you will not receive these events.

Constructor

new()
parameters
src An initial video source. May be null, in which case the [play()] method must be called to start the video
numLoops Number of play loops. -1 is infinite.
width Width of the rendering BitmapData surface onto which the video data is rendered.
height Height of the rendering BitmapData surface onto which the video data is rendered.
updateMS Milliseconds between redrawing BitmapData
attr Additional material attributes
Creates a new VideoMaterialEx. The quality of the rendered surface depends on the width and height parameters.

inherited from sandy.materials.Material

inherited from sandy.materials.Material

loops : Int

Number of loops, default to -1 to repeat continually. Set to 0 for 1 play, 1 for 2 plays etc.

maxRecurssionDepth : Int

inherited from sandy.materials.BitmapMaterial
Maximum recurssion depth when using precision > 1 (which enables the perspective correction). The bigger the number is, the more accurate the result will be. Try to change this value to fits your needs to obtain the best performance.

inherited from sandy.materials.Material

true if this material or its line attributes were modified since last rendered, false otherwise.

Pauses playback.

play(default,method) : src : VideoSource -> ?resetPlaylist : Bool -> Void

Plays the specified video source.

precision : Int

inherited from sandy.materials.BitmapMaterial
Precision of the bitmap mapping. This material uses an affine linear mapping. It results in a lack of accuracy at rendering time when the surface to draw is too big. One usual solution is to augment the number of polygon, but the performance cost can be quite big. Another solution is to change the precision property value. The lower the value, the more accurate the perspective correction is. To disable the perspective correction, set this property to zero, which is also the default value If you use the precision to solve the distortion issue, you can reduce the primitives quality (except if you are experiencing some sorting issues)

removeEventListener(default,method) : type : String -> listener : (Dynamic -> Void) -> ?useCapture : Bool -> Void

setTransparency(default,method) : p_nValue : Float -> Void

setTransparency(default,method) : p_nValue : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.materials.BitmapMaterial
Changes the transparency of the texture.

The passed value is the percentage of opacity. Note that in order for this to work with animated texture, you need set material transparency every time after new texture frame is rendered.

smooth : Bool

inherited from sandy.materials.BitmapMaterial
This property enables smooth bitmap rendering when set to true. The default value is set to false to have the best performance first. Enable this property have a performance impact, use it warefully

soundMaxPan(default,__setSoundMaxPan) : Float

Maximal pan is a positive Number from 0-1. If 0, no panning will occur, otherwise panning of the sound is relative to the camera rotation. Defaults to 1.0

soundRadius : Float

The radius of the sound. Defaults to 1000

soundVolume(default,__setSoundVolume) : Float

Max volume of the sound if camera position is at sound position, multiplied by the volume of the VideoSource to calculate total volume. Defaults to 1.0.

status(default,null) : PlayStatus

The current status of the play state.

stop(default,method) : Void -> Void

Stops playback, resetting the playhead to 0.0 seconds. Does not stop download of video data, except in the case of an VST_RTMP server that does not support the pause method.
